choices.text:
what are the verb tenses?
Verb tenses refer to the form of a verb that indicates the time when an action occurred or will occur. In English, there are 12 verb tenses that express different aspects of time, including:

1. Present Tense: verbs that describe actions that are happening now or ongoing
2. Past Tense: verbs that describe actions that have already happened
3. Future Tense: verbs that describe actions that will happen in the future
4. Present Perfect Tense: verbs that describe actions that started in the past and continue to the present
5. Past Perfect Tense: verbs that describe actions that had already completed before another action in the past
6. Future Perfect Tense: verbs that describe actions that will have been completed by a specific time in the future
7. Present Continuous Tense: verbs that describe actions that are happening now and may not be finished
8. Past Continuous Tense: verbs that describe actions that were happening before another action in the past
9. Future Continuous Tense: verbs that describe actions that will be happening at a specific time in the future
10. Present Perfect Continuous Tense: verbs that describe actions that have been going on for a period of time up to now
11. Past Perfect Continuous Tense: verbs that describe actions that were happening before another action in the past and had been going on for some time
12. Future Perfect Continuous Tense: verbs that describe actions that will have been going on for a period of time by a specific time in the future.
